originalText: SENSORY PERCEPTION - ABILITY TO RESPOND MEANINGFULLY TO PRESSURE-RELATED DISCOMFORT TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Sensory perception: ability to respond meaningfully to pressure-related discomfort:

responses.text: COMPLETELY LIMITED - UNRESPONSIVE (DOES NOT MOAN, FLINCH OR GRASP) TO PAINFUL STIMULI, DUE TO DIMINISHED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS OR SEDATION OR LIMITED ABILITY TO FEEL PAIN OVER MOST OF BODY SURFACES
responses.cleanedText: Completely Limited - Unresponsive (does not moan, flinch or grasp) to painful stimuli, due to diminished level of consciousness or sedation or limited ability to feel pain over most of body surfaces

responses.text: VERY LIMITED - RESPONDS ONLY TO PAINFUL STIMULI. CANNOT COMMUNICATE DISCOMFORT EXCEPT BY MOANING OR RESTLESNESS, OR HAS A SENSORY IMPAIRMENT WHICH LIMITS THE ABILITY TO FEEL PAIN OR DISCOMFORT OVER HALF OF BODY.
responses.cleanedText: Very Limited - Responds only to painful stimuli. cannot communicate discomfort except by moaning or restlesness, or has a sensory impairment which limits the ability to feel pain or discomfort over half of body.

responses.text: SLIGHTLY LIMITED - RESPONDS TO VERBAL COMMANDS BUT CANNOT ALWAYS COMMUNICATE DISCOMFORT OR NEED TO BE TURNED, OR HAS SOME SENSORY IMPAIRMENT WHICH LIMITS ABILITY TO FEEL PAIN OR DISCOMFORT IN 1 OR 2 EXTREMITIES.
responses.cleanedText: Slightly Limited - Responds to verbal commands but cannot always communicate discomfort or need to be turned, or has some sensory impairment which limits ability to feel pain or discomfort in 1 or 2 extremities.

responses.text: NO IMPAIRMENT - RESPONDS TO VERBAL COMMANDS. HAS NO SENSORY DEFICIT WHICH WOULD LIMIT ABILITY TO FEEL OR VOICE PAIN OR DISCOMFORT.
responses.cleanedText: No Impairment - Responds to verbal commands. has no sensory deficit which would limit ability to feel or voice pain or discomfort.

originalText: MOISTURE - DEGREE TO WHICH SKIN IS EXPOSED TO MOISTURE TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Moisture: degree to which skin is exposed to moisture:

responses.text: CONSTANTLY MOIST - SKIN IS KEPT MOIST ALMOST CONSTANTLY BY PERSPIRATION, URINE, ETC. DAMPNESS IS DETECTED EVERY TIME PATIENT IS MOVED OR TURNED.
responses.cleanedText: Constantly Moist - Skin is kept moist almost constantly by perspiration, urine, etc. Dampness is detected every time patient is moved or turned.

responses.text: OFTEN MOIST - SKIN IS OFTEN BUT NOT ALWAYS MOIST. LINEN MUST BE CHANGED AS OFTEN AS 3 TIMES IN 24 HOURS.
responses.cleanedText: Often Moist - Skin is often but not always moist. Linen must be changed as often as 3 times in 24 hours.

responses.text: OCCASIONALLY MOIST - SKIN IS OCCASIONALLY MOIST, REQUIRING AN EXTRA LINEN CHANGE APPROXIMATELY ONCE A DAY.
responses.cleanedText: Occasionally Moist - Skin is occasionally moist, requiring an extra linen change approximately once a day.

responses.text: RARELY MOIST - SKIN IS USUALLY DRY. LINEN ONLY REQUIRES CHANGING AT ROUTINE INTERVALS.
responses.cleanedText: Rarely Moist - Skin is usually dry. Linen only requires changing at routine intervals.

originalText: ACTIVITY - DEGREE OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Activity: degree of physical activity:

responses.text: CHAIRFAST - ABILITY TO WALK SEVERELY LIMITED OR NON-EXISTENT. CANNOT BEAR OWN WEIGHT AND/OR MUST BE ASSISTED INTO CHAIR OR WHEELCHAIR.
responses.cleanedText: Chairfast - Ability to walk severely limited or non-existent. Cannot bear own weight and/or must be assisted into chair or wheelchair.

responses.text: WALKS OCCASIONALLY - WALKS OCCASIONALLY DURING DAY, BUT FOR VERY SHORT DISTANCES, WITH OR WITHOUT ASSISTANCE. SPENDS MAJORITY OF DAY IN BED OR CHAIR.
responses.cleanedText: Walks Occasionally - Walks occasionally during day, but for very short distances, with or without assistance. Spends majority of day in bed or chair.

responses.text: WALKS FREQUENTLY - WALKS OUTSIDE BEDROOM TWICE A DAY AND INSIDE ROOM AT LEAST ONCE EVERY TWO HOURS DURING WAKING HOURS.
responses.cleanedText: Walks Frequently - Walks outside bedroom twice a day and inside room at least once every two hours during waking hours.

originalText: MOBILITY - ABILITY TO CHANGE AND CONTROL BODY POSITION TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Mobility: ability to change and control body position:

responses.text: COMPLETELY IMMOBILE - DOES NOT MAKE EVEN SLIGHT CHANGES IN BODY OR EXTREMITY POSITION WITHOUT ASSISTANCE.
responses.cleanedText: Completely Immobile - Does not make even slight changes in body or extremity position without assistance.

responses.text: VERY LIMITED - MAKES OCCASIONAL SLIGHT CHANGES IN BODY OR EXTREMITY POSITION BUT UNABLE TO MAKE FREQUENT OR SIGNIFICANT CHANGES INDEPENDENTLY.
responses.cleanedText: Very Limited - Makes occasional slight changes in body or extremity position but unable to make frequent or significant changes independently.

responses.text: SLIGHTLY LIMITED - MAKES FREQUENT THOUGH SLIGHT CHANGES IN BODY OR EXTREMITY POSITION INDEPENDENTLY.
responses.cleanedText: Slightly Limited - Makes frequent though slight changes in body or extremity position independently.

responses.text: NO LIMITATIONS - MAKES MAJOR AND FREQUENT CHANGES IN POSITION WITHOUT ASSISTANCE.
responses.cleanedText: No Limitations - Makes major and frequent changes in position without assistance.

originalText: NUTRITION - USUAL FOOD INTAKE PATTERN TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Nutrition: usual food intake pattern:

responses.text: VERY POOR - NEVER EATS A COMPLETE MEAL. RARELY EATS MORE THAN 1/3 OF ANY FOOD OFFERED. EATS 2 SERVIINGS OR LESS OF PROTEIN (MEAT OR DAIRY PRODUCTS) PER DAY. TAKES FLUIDS POORLY. DOES NOT TAKE A LIQUID DIETARY SUPPLEMENT, OR IS NPO AND/OR MAINTAINED ON CLEAR LIQUIDS OR IV FOR MORE THAN 5 DAYS.
responses.cleanedText: Very Poor - Never eats a complete meal. Rarely eats more than 1/3 of any food offered. Eats 2 serviings or less of protein (meat or dairy products) per day. Takes fluids poorly. Does not take a liquid dietary supplement, or is NPO and/or maintained on clear liquids or IV for more than 5 days.

responses.text: PROBABLY INADEQUATE - RARELY EATS A COMPLETE MEAL AND GENERALLY EATS ONLY ABOUT 1/2 OF ANY FOOD OFFERED. PROTEIN INTAKE INCLUDES ONLY 3 SERVINGS OF MEAT OR DAIRY PRODUCTS PER DAY. OCCASIONALLY WILL TAKE A DIETARY SUPPLEMENT, OR RECEIVES LESS THAN OPTIMUM AMOUNT OF LIQUID DIET OR TUBE FEEDING.
responses.cleanedText: Probably Inadequate - Rarely eats a complete meal and generally eats only about 1/2 of any food offered. Protein intake includes only 3 servings of meat or dairy products per day. Occasionally will take a dietary supplement, or receives less than optimum amount of liquid diet or tube feeding.

responses.text: ADEQUATE - EATS OVER HALF OF MOST MEALS. EATS A TOTAL OF 4 SERVINGS OF PROTEIN (MEAT, DAIRY PRODUCTS) PER DAY. OCCASIONALLY WILL REFUSE A MEAL, BUT WILL USUALLY TAKE A SUPPLEMENT WHEN OFFERED, OR IS ON A TUBE FEEDING OR TPN REGIMEN, WHICH PROBABLY MEETS MOST OF NUTRITIONAL NEEDS.
responses.cleanedText: Adequate - Eats over half of most meals. Eats a total of 4 servings of protein (meat, dairy products) per day. occasionally will refuse a meal, but will usually take a supplement when offered, or is on a tube feeding or TPN regimen, which probably meets most of nutritional needs.

responses.text: EXCELLENT - EATS MOST OF EVERY MEAL. NEVER REFUSES A MEAL. USUALLY EATS A TOTAL OF 4 OR MORE SERVINGS OF MEAT AND DAIRY PRODUCTS. OCCASIONALLY EATS BETWEEN MEALS. DOES NOT REQUIRE SUPPLEMENTATION.
responses.cleanedText: Excellent - Eats most of every meal. Never refuses a meal. Usually eats a total of 4 or more servings of meat and dairy products. Occasionally eats between meals. does not require supplementation.

originalText: FRICTION AND SHEAR TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Friction and shear:

responses.text: PROBLEM - REQUIRES MODERATE TO MAXIMUM ASSISTANCE IN MOVING. COMPLETE LIFTING WITHOUT SLIDING AGAINST SHEETS IS IMPOSSIBLE. FREQUENTLY SLIDES DOWN IN BED OR CHAIR, REQUIRING FREQUENT REPOSITIONING WITH MAXIMUM ASSISTANCE. SPASTICITY, CONTRACTURES, OR AGITATION LEADS TO ALMOST CONSTANT FRICTION.
responses.cleanedText: Problem - Requires moderate to maximum assistance in moving. complete lifting without sliding against sheets is impossible. Frequently slides down in bed or chair, requiring frequent repositioning with maximum assistance. Spasticity, contractures, or agitation leads to almost constant friction.

responses.text: POTENTIAL PROBLEM - MOVES FEEBLY OR REQUIRES MINIMUM ASSISTANCE. DURING A MOVE SKIN PROBABLY SLIDES TO SOME EXTENT AGAINST SHEETS, CHAIR, RESTRAINTS, OR OTHER DEVICES. MAINTAINS RELATIVELY GOOD POSITION IN CHAIR OR BED MOST OF THE TIME BUT OCCASIONALLY SLIDES DOWN.
responses.cleanedText: Potential Problem - Moves feebly or requires minimum assistance. During a move, skin probably slides to some extent against sheets, chair, restraints, or other devices. Maintains relatively good position in chair or bed most of the time, but occasionally slides down.

responses.text: NO APPARENT PROBLEM - MOVES IN BED AND IN CHAIR INDEPENDENTLY AND HAS SUFFICIENT MUSCLE STRENGTH TO LIFT UP COMPLETELY DURING MOVE. MAINTAINS GOOD POSITION IN BED OR CHAIR.
responses.cleanedText: No Apparent Problem - Moves in bed and in chair independently and has sufficient muscle strength to lift up completely during move. Maintains good position in bed or chair.

cleanedText: Prior history of falls within 3 months: an unintentional change in position resulting in coming to rest on the ground or at a lower level:

originalText: INCONTINENCE -- INABILITY TO MAKE IT TO THE BATHROOM OR COMMODE IN TIMELY MANNER INCLUDES FREQUENCY, URGENCY, AND/OR NOCTURIA. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Incontinence: inability to make it to the bathroom or commode in timely manner includes frequency, urgency, and/or nocturia:

originalText: VISUAL IMPAIRMENT -- INCLUDES BUT NOT LIMITED TO, MACULAR DEGENERATION, DIABETIC RETINOPATHIES, VISUAL FIELD LOSS, AGE RELATED CHANGES, DECLINE IN VISUAL ACUITY, ACCOMMODATION, GLARE TOLERANCE, DEPTH PERCEPTION, AND NIGHT VISION OR NOT WEARING PRESCRIBED GLASSES OR HAVING THE CORRECT PRESCRIPTION. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Visual impairment: includes but not limited to, macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathies, visual field loss, age related changes, decline in visual acuity, accommodation, glare tolerance, depth perception, and night vision or not wearing prescribed glasses or having the correct prescription:

originalText: IMPAIRED FUNCTIONAL MOBILITY -- MAY INCLUDE PATIENTS WHO NEED HELP WITH IADLS OR ADLS OR HAVE GAIT OR TRANSFER PROBLEMS, ARTHRITIS, PAIN,  FEAR OF FALLING, FOOT PROBLEMS, IMPAIRED SENSATION, IMPAIRED COORDINATION OR IMPROPER USE OF ASSISTIVE DEVICES. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Impaired functional mobility: may include patients who need help with IADLs or ADLs or have gait or transfer problems, arthritis, pain, fear of falling, foot problems, impaired sensation, impaired coordination or improper use of assistive devices:

originalText: ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS -- MAY INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO, POOR ILLUMINATION, EQUIPMENT TUBING, INAPPROPRIATE FOOTWEAR, PETS, HARD TO REACH ITEMS, FLOOR SURFACES THAT ARE UNEVEN OR CLUTTERED, OR OUTDOOR ENTRY AND EXITS. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Environmental hazards: may include but not limited to, poor illumination, equipment tubing, inappropriate footwear, pets, hard to reach items, floor surfaces that are uneven or cluttered, or outdoor entry and exits:

originalText: POLY PHARMACY (4 OR MORE PRESCRIPTIONS - ANY TYPE) -- ALL PRESCRIPTIONS INCLUDING PRESCRIPTIONS FOR OTC MEDS.  DRUGS HIGHLY ASSOCIATED WITH FALL RISK INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SEDATIVES, ANTI-DEPRESSANTS, TRANQUILIZERS, NARCOTICS, ANTIHYPERTENSIVES, CARDIAC MEDS, CORTICOSTEROIDS, ANTI-ANXIETY DRUGS, ANTICHOLINERGIC DRUGS, AND HYPOGLYCEMIC DRUGS. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Poly pharmacy (4 or more prescriptions: any type): all prescriptions including prescriptions for OTC meds. drugs highly associated with fall risk include but not limited to, sedatives, antidepressants, tranquilizers, narcotics, antihypertensives, cardiac meds, corticosteroids, anti-anxiety drugs, anticholinergic drugs, and hypoglycemic drugs:

originalText: PAIN AFFECTING LEVEL OF FUNCTION -- PAIN OFTEN AFFECTS AN INDIVIDUAL'S DESIRE OR ABILITY TO MOVE, OR PAIN CAN BE  A FACTOR IN DEPRESSION OR COMPLIANCE WITH SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Pain affecting level of function: pain often affects an individual's desire or ability to move, or pain can be a factor in depression or compliance with safety recommendations:

originalText: COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT -- COULD INCLUDE PATIENTS WITH DEMENTIA, ALZHEIMER'S OR STROKE PATIENTS, OR PATIENTS WHO ARE CONFUSED, USE POOR JUDGMENT, HAVE DECREASED COMPREHENSION, IMPULSIVITY, MEMORY DEFICITS. CONSIDER PATIENTS ABILITY TO ADHERE TO THE PLAN OF CARE. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
cleanedText: Cognitive impairment: could include patients with dementia, Alzheimer's or stroke patients, or patients who are confused, use poor judgment, have decreased comprehension, impulsivity, memory deficits. consider patients ability to adhere to the plan of care:
